title: ASUS VivoBook 15 Ryzen 3 Dual Core - (4 GB/256 GB SSD/Windows 10 Home) M515DA-BQ312TS Thin and Light Laptop  (15.6 inch, Transparent Silver, 1.80 Kg, With MS Office)

product_specification.Sales Package: Laptop, Power Adaptor, User Guide, Warranty Documents
product_specification.Clock Speed: 2.6 GHz with Turbo Boost Upto 3.5 GHz
product_specification.USB Port: 1 x USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type-A, 1 x USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type-C, 2 x USB 2.0 Type-A
product_specification.Screen Type: Full HD Anti-glare Display (250nits Brightness, 83% Screen-to-body Ratio, IPS-level Panel)
product_specification.Included Software: Microsoft Office Home and Student 2019, Splendid (All models), Tru2Life (Intel Platform Models), Link to MyASUS (All Models, Bluetooth Needed)

product_description.Compact and Portable: The powerful interior and portable exterior make the ASUS VivoBook 15 an ideal laptop for work and play. Furthermore, its NanoEdge display along with a matte anti-glare coating ensures an engaging viewing experience.
product_description.Efficient Performance: A cutting-edge, powerful processor ensures that this ASUS laptop delivers lag-free, smooth performance while working, playing, or enjoying entertainment.
product_description.Storage Capacity: The storage capacity offers both high-speed data performance and ample storage capacity. So, you can download, install, and load apps in no time. Also, you can store music, photos, videos, and much more on this laptop.
product_description.Wide View: The NanoEdge Display of this laptop offers an immersive experience while working or playing. Furthermore, the wide-view FHD panel has an anti-glare coating. As a result, you see distraction-free visuals without reflections and glares.
product_description.Lightweight and Portable: This 1.8 kg laptop is easily portable, so you can carry it along wherever you want.
product_description.Touch to Login: This ASUS laptop comes with a built-in fingerprint sensor on its touchpad along with Windows Hello. So, you do not have to type a password to log in.

review:
I was confused between asus and lenovo s145 laptop but chose go with this laptop because of build quality.

Lenovo s145 feels quite flimsy while asus is reinforced with metal plates under the keyboard and in side supports of screen.

4gb ram and ryzen 3250u is good for everyday uses and light office work like browsing with5-6 tab oepn in chrome and 2-3 office files and for heavy uses there option to increase ram capacity.

Ssd read speeds are quite fast 950mb/s and write speed upto 350mb/s therefore it feels quite snappy and there is option to add hdd later for more storage(bracket provided inside).

Also the screen display quality(ips-level(asus) vs TN(lenovo)) and brightness is better 250 nits compared to 220 nits of s145.

Absolutely great product. Beautiful design, the ips level display.... Absolutely stunning. Packaging was secure too.

Now lets come to the performance. The SSD inside it gives the performance a big boost. 4 gigs of ram is sufficient for light multitasking (I'll add 4gigs of ram later). The laptop boots up in just 6-7 sec, and there's no lag in app opening and closing.

Battery performance is good I'd say. I was typing a document in MS word, and the laptop only consumed 6% of the battery in 45...
READ MORE

It's an amazing laptop in this prize segment. Because in this prize we get all types of specifications and aspects... Like it having 256GB SSD drive, FHD display, a allround king processor unit everything is fine.i using this laptop till 8days ago... I think this was my right option.

Props:---

1.FHD Display ---one of the good IPS LCD display with good resolution capacity

2.SSD :--- the maximum boot up time will taken approximately 4second to 6 second

3.Ryzen 3 3340U :---- all round an excellent processor as comparing to intel.i think rizen ia the better option.

4. Superb Classic Shining Look :--- It absolutely good disigning modulation.. Love it❤️



5.less weight :----it arround 1.6kg approximately


6.it having fingerprint sensor :---it is so helping our privacy and security

Cones:---

The one and only cone that is it's body having plastic. But it look like a premium metallic coating

And Battery Backup is little bit of weak. Approximately 4hours

Absolutely worth it... Just go for it🔥🔥

First I would like to thank flipcart for sending this great product in 3 days .
REVIEW -... I BOUGHT IT IN 32K IN BIG BILLION DAYS SALE .
1. The looks of this laptop is great and nyc.

2. Speed is fantastic running like butter on daily
usese remember it is not a gaming laptop so don't try heavy software. I install a android emulator on it and when I open the software I can clearly hear the noise of fan.

3. it boot up in 6 second and off in 3 second thanks to nvme SSD remember there is only a 240 GB SSD they wrote false that there is 256gb SSD .

4. The battery is ok for normal usese 5 to 6 hours
And some heavy user get 3 to 4 hour backup.
( I didn't like the charger because there is a
3 pin plug cable provide with this and the cable plug in to charger than the charger work,
I attached a photo of chager.) Full charge in 2 hours and comes with 45 watt adapter.

5. Display is great because it is full hd so there is no problem and brightness is more than enough.

6. I am a light user so I don't need more ram but if you want to upgrade there is another slot for
Ram (4+8 = 12 maximum) and a slot for HDD.

Speed --- 5/5🥰🥰🥰
Battery 🔋 -- 4/5
Charger -- 3/5
Display -- 4.5/5
Build quality -- 3/5
Looks -- 4/5

7. Windows 11 update is already there so if u want
To download windows 11 you can anytime but I suggest you not to upgrade windows 11 and wait for its proper stable update.

8. Build quality of this laptop could have been better yes the laptop looks premium but it doesn't feel premium like when you open you hear a plastic hinges sound and keyboard keys are ok ok.

Thanku so much for reading I will update my review in near future 🙂

The product is realy good and value for money battery life is not up to the mark but its ok in this price range .it is best for online class and study ,you can play small games but not a big game like pubg and gta 5 butin low setting you can play

In light usage its to fast for office work and study it is best

My 7 days review and I upgraded to Windows 11
1.Except VGA camera, everything is good.
2.It get heated when u do heavy work. I think every laptop get heated when CPU usage more Power.
3.I am using for programing n tools I use are VS code, Postman n also chrome (8-9 tabs), still no lags.
4.All above observation is of 4gb of ram so I will update my ram by 8gb.
5.Also I play Asphalt 9 still no lags.
6.My frd have i3 10th gen laptop and I buy Ryzen 3 laptop. Trust me Ryzen 3 gives me great performance than i3.
6.Overall everything is good. If u hv budget between 30-35k...u must go for this laptop.

I am writing review after 1 month of continuous use
I loved the performance
My honest review
1. Battery 🔋 backup is approximately 5 hr
2. Display is amazing
3.Design is also cool
4.Sound is clear & loud
5. Feels smooth while using 😀

Attractive design .
Very fast booting ,it takes only 5-7 second.
No lags by multiple work .
Display is good .

I was confused between asus and lenovo s145 laptop but chose go with this laptop because of build quality.

Lenovo s145 feels quite flimsy while asus is reinforced with metal plates under the keyboard and in side supports of screen.

4gb ram and ryzen 3250u is good for everyday uses and light office work like browsing with5-6 tab oepn in chrome and 2-3 office files and for heavy uses there option to increase ram capacity.

Ssd read speeds are quite fast 950mb/s and write speed upto 350mb/s therefore it feels quite snappy and there is option to add hdd later for more storage(bracket provided inside).

Also the screen display quality(ips-level(asus) vs TN(lenovo)) and brightness is better 250 nits compared to 220 nits of s145.

Absolutely great product. Beautiful design, the ips level display.... Absolutely stunning. Packaging was secure too.

Now lets come to the performance. The SSD inside it gives the performance a big boost. 4 gigs of ram is sufficient for light multitasking (I'll add 4gigs of ram later). The laptop boots up in just 6-7 sec, and there's no lag in app opening and closing.

Battery performance is good I'd say. I was typing a document in MS word, and the laptop only consumed 6% of the battery in 45 minutes. Yet to test the battery when connected to internet.

For students its a very good laptop. Within 32k you're getting ms office, windows 10 Home, everything.

Only one disclaimer - This is not a gaming laptop, so don't try to play games. Will update the review time to time.

Edit: Great battery backup! 6-7 hours in normal usage (without internet) and 3-4 hours while connected to internet. And the laptop doesn't heat much even if you're doing heavy tasks. Normal heating is observed, and the cooling fan is really silent.

Thank you ASUS and flipkart for this great value for money product! For day to day tasks, and for sometimes heavy usage, it's really that great.

This is a honest and a genuine review:-
Pros:- 1)Great Display
2)Amd ryzen 3 3250u > Intel i3 11th gen
3)Good for coding and to learn programming languages.
4)Good for video editing and Photoshop
5) Software included (ms office 2019 lifetime + 1 year McAfee antivirus.
6) You can also play high end games but you'll face major frame drops so I don't recommend this for heavy gaming but you can play moderate games.
7) Fingerprint sensor for faster access.

Cons:- 1)Very bad camera
2) Battery backup is not that good you can get 3 hours of battery backup while coding or editing and 4-5 hours in normal usage (depends upon which software you're using )

Verdict :- It's best laptop under 40k don't hesitate just buy it if you're confused overall experience is completely amazing

Great laptop at the price range.
Got it for 28k excluding 1k supercoins.
Lightweight sleek design, best part is nano edge FHD display!
Boots in 3-5 seconds thanks to ssd storage and day to day operations are snappy fast!
Ui works like butter and comes pre-installed with windows 10 and ms office 15.
Fingerprint scanner is a good addition and adds an extra layer of security.
Battery backup is decent and would give 6-7 hours without internet. 4 hours with wifi on.
Sound quality is also decent with speaker grills both sides below the laptop.
Comes with ram and hdd slots for upgrading!
Overall best laptop found under Rs. 30k!

I have been a fan of Asus for some years now. They have after all, pioneered expandable storage in ultra-slim laptops and give good quality configs at a budget price-point.
This model comes in that same bracket. But the experience of good components is spoiled by some glaring flaws in the design.

PROs-
- BUILD: Light and strong plastic.
- LID AND HINGE: Smooth hinge (better than the creaky experience of my previous Asus). Attractive.
- KEYBOARD AND BASE: Decent keyboard experience (not as good as the older Vivobooks, but better than Acer). Base is matte plastic and easy to open. No warranty seals.
- PORTS: Good. 2xUSB 2, 1x USB3, 1xUSB-C, 1xHMDI, 1x3.5mm jack. NO SD/MicroSD.
- SCREEN: Sharp, good brightness, easy view (matte). Good colour balance.
- HARDWARE: Good quality. Speedy CPU, fast SSD (WD SN570). Works great with the given 4GB RAM (SSD is fast).
- BATTERY LIFE: Good. Idle power usage is between 4-8W (so gives 4-6 hrs backup).

CONS-
- BUILD: Lid is prone to scratches. All else is good.
- LID and HINGE: Hinge does not open wide. While the movement is smooth, the stop at the widest angle is not very apparent.
- KEYBOARD and BASE: Keyboard is NOT backlit. And NumPad is 3 column (unlike 4 column of Dell/Lenovo).
- PORTS: USB ports little tight.
- SCREEN: No Cons
- HARDWARE: Biggest cons here. First off- AMD drivers seem unreliable. I get BSODs almost every other day with a message "Driver Power Delivery Failure" or something like that. Never had a single BSOD in all my other laptops in Windows 10 (1st Gen i3 to 7th Gen i3). Also the cooling system is very inefficient (no heatpipe and a small fan blows over the CPU across the motherboard). This leads to high CPU temps and a noisy fan even in basic usage. This cooling system is now standard in budget Asus laptops (the ones with the vents on the left side). Not a good experience- affects usability, creates trepidation when putting the laptop to demanding tasks and may affect longevity of the hardware).
- BATTERY LIFE: Cannot configure CPU speeds with windows power profiles. The newer Intel and AMD CPUs have a very low non-turbo speed (~1.7GHz), so you have to leave turbo on. So battery life is fairly unpredictable depending on how much turbo kicks in.

SUMMARY- Better than other offerings in this range. But recommend skipping this price range and stepping up for better hardware, good cooling and latest CPUs.
